family.name: navigations

uri-part.name: node-id
uri-part.description: The navigation ID. Navigation nodes can have other child nodes. The node-id is a list of all ids denoting the path from the root node. For the root node, the navigation id is a list containing one element.

resource.name: navigations
resource.description: All the top level navigation nodes for a store.

relationship.name: navigations-from-root
relationship.description: Navigations can be found from the root resource.

relationship.name: navigation-to-top
relationship.description: The navigation to the top navigations resource.

relationship.name: parent-node-to-child
relationship.description: Navigate from a parent to a child navigation.

property.name: name
property.description: The Cortex system's name for the node.

property.name: display-name
property.description: The localized name of the node, intended for display in the client application.

property.name: details
property.description: An array of the navigation node's attributes. Attributes describe the details of the navigation node, like the node's name, description, associated subcategories, etc. Attributes are different each store. To get a list of navigation attributes, you'll need to coordinate with your store marketer who creates these navigation nodes and attributes.
